searchResult.title: WILD WILD WEST
searchResult.overview: Bardia National Park is a protected area in Nepal that was established in 1988 as Royal Bardia National Park. Covering an area of 968 km2 (374 sq mi) it is the largest and most undisturbed wilderness area in Nepal’s Terai, adjoining the eastern bank of the Karnali River in the Bardiya District. About 70% of the park is covered with forest, with the balance a mixture of grassland, savannah and riverine forest The flora recorded in the park comprises 839 species of flora, including 173 vascular plant species comprising 140 dicots, 26 monocots, six fern, and one gymnosperm species. Bardiya national park has the greatest number of deer species.

searchResult.meta_description: The Bardia National Park is the largest and most undisturbed protected area in the terai that is home to the endangered Royal Bengal Tiger and Nepal's famous one horned rhinoceros. Spread in the 968 sq km area, Bardia is the largest National park in Terai.

searchResult.title: AYODHYA  EXTENDED
searchResult.overview:
This is an extension of the Prayag Snan tour. Prayagraj, formerly known as Allahabad, is a city in Uttar Pradesh, the city is close to the Triveni Sangam, which is the three-river confluence of the rivers of Ganga, Yamuna and Saraswati. Hence the name Prayag, which means the “confluence of rivers.” 

The northern part of India features several extremely well-known religious places. The Prayagraj (formerly known as Allahabad), Ayodhya and Varanasi tour will take you through the favoured religious locations. It is at Prayagraj where the 12 years Kumbh Mela is held. The city is famed for its history, literature and architecture.

searchResult.meta_description: From the holy shoreline of Ganga to the elegant globe of Awadhi Nawabs and from the dynamic joyful festivities of Holi to the amazing dishes like kebabs, biryanis and khormas, the area is constantly interesting and full of amazing things exposed at every footstep. Varanasi Ayodhya Allahabad tour also serves to those highly considering checking religious scenery of India as it includes the homeland of Lord Rama, beloved city of Lord Shiva and the location of holy confluence Prayag.

searchResult.title: TEMPLE & TIGERS
searchResult.overview: A visit to Chitwan reveals an unexpected side to Nepal yet an attractive proposition for nature lovers. Located at the terai fringe of the Indian plains, the national park boasts diverse forest with magnificent wildlife experiences. The Royal Bengal Tiger, Asian Rhinoceros, Gharial, Langur, Rhesus, Macaque Monkey are some of them.
